required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Determine Whether Two Differing Strength Tablets (3 x 5 mg Versus 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Org 5222 (Asenapine) Are Safe and Equal in Subjects With Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder (P05937)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-center, Open-label, 2-way Crossover Relative Bioavailability and Safety Trial With Two Differing Strength Tablets (3 x 5 mg vs. 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 in Subjects With Schizophrenia or Schizoaffective Disorder.

brief_summary.textblock: A trial to compare if one 15 mg under the tongue tablet is equal to three 5 mg under the tongue tablets of Org 5222 (asenapine) in subjects with schizophrenia or schizoaffective disorder delivered.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Two Differing Tablet Strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 (Asenapine)
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective is to compare the bioavailability using pharmacokinetic parameter of maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of two differing tablet strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of sublingually administered Org 5222 Measurements were performed after each cross-over period: Day 5 measurement for 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 2; Day 7 measurement for 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 2.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Time of Occurrence of Cmax (Tmax) of Two Differing Tablet Strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 (Asenapine)
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective is to compare the bioavailability using pharmacokinetic parameter of time of occurrence of Cmax (Tmax) of two differing tablet strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of sublingually administered Org 5222. Measurements were performed after each cross-over period: Day 5 measurement for 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 2; Day 7 measurement for 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 2

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Two Differing Tablet Strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 (Asenapine)
primary_outcome.description: The primary objective is to compare the bioavailability using pharmacokinetic parameter of area under the curve (AUC) of two differing tablet strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of sublingually administered Org 5222. Measurements were performed after each cross-over period: Day 5 measurement for 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 2; Day 7 measurement for 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 2.

intervention.description: Three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 2 days followed by one 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 1.5 days
One 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 2 days followed by three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 1.5 days.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All subjects rec'd asenapine 5mg BID on Day 1 & 10mg BID on Day 2. Subjects rec'd 15mg BID (either 3x5mg or 1x15mg according to their randomized sequence) from the morning dose on Day 3 through the morning dose on Day 5, followed by the alternate treatment (either 3x5mg or 1x15mg) from the evening dose on Day 5 through the morning dose on Day 7.

group.title: Asenapine, (3) 5mg Then (1) 15 mg
group.description: Three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 2 days followed by one 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 1.5 days.

group.title: Asenapine, (1) 15 mg Then (3) 5 mg
group.description: One 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 2 days followed by three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 1.5 days.

period.title: Day 1 Through AM Dose of Day 5
PM Dose of Day 5 Through AM Dose of Day7

group.title: Asenapine, (3) 5 mg Then (1) 15 mg
group.description: Three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 2 days followed by one 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 1.5 days

group.title: Asenapine, (1) 15 mg Then (3) 5 mg
group.description: One 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 2 days followed by three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 1.5 days

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Two Differing Tablet Strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 (Asenapine)
outcome.description: The primary objective is to compare the bioavailability using pharmacokinetic parameter of maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) of two differing tablet strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of sublingually administered Org 5222 Measurements were performed after each cross-over period: Day 5 measurement for 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 2; Day 7 measurement for 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 2.
outcome.population: All participants were included in both treatment comparisons (as per cross over design).

group.title: Asenapine 3x5mg
group.description: Three 5 mg sublingual tablets (15 mg) given twice daily for 2 or 1.5 days (depending on sequence of participant)

group.title: Asenapine 1x15mg
group.description: One 15 mg sublingual tablet given twice daily for 2 or 1.5 days (depending on sequence of participant)

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Time of Occurrence of Cmax (Tmax) of Two Differing Tablet Strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 (Asenapine)
outcome.description: The primary objective is to compare the bioavailability using pharmacokinetic parameter of time of occurrence of Cmax (Tmax) of two differing tablet strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of sublingually administered Org 5222. Measurements were performed after each cross-over period: Day 5 measurement for 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 2; Day 7 measurement for 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 2
outcome.population: All participants were included in both treatment comparisons (as per cross over design).

outcome.title: Pharmacokinetic Parameter of Area Under the Curve (AUC) of Two Differing Tablet Strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of Sublingually Administered Org 5222 (Asenapine)
outcome.description: The primary objective is to compare the bioavailability using pharmacokinetic parameter of area under the curve (AUC) of two differing tablet strengths (3 x 5 mg and 1 x 15 mg) of sublingually administered Org 5222. Measurements were performed after each cross-over period: Day 5 measurement for 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 2; Day 7 measurement for 1x15mg for participants from Sequence 1 and 3x5mg for participants from Sequence 2.
outcome.population: All participants were included in both treatment comparisons (as per cross over design).

reported_events.desc: All subjects rec'd asenapine 5mg BID on Day 1 & 10mg BID on Day 2. Subjects rec'd 15mg BID (either 3x5mg or 1x15mg according to their randomized sequence) from the morning dose on Day 3 through the morning dose on Day 5, followed by the alternate treatment (either 3x5mg or 1x15mg) from the evening dose on Day 5 through the morning dose on Day 7.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: All publications must be based on data validated by Organon. Any such communication will first be submitted to Organon, at least 6 weeks ahead of time for written consent. Organon shall have the right to make its consent conditional upon proper representation of the interpretation of both Organon and the investigator. In any communication concerning this trial, the authors of this protocol will be included in the list of authors.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Vice President, Late Stage Development Group Leader
